root: ^Indra, would you mind if I opened your blinds? It’s kinda dark in here and I want to do your portrait with natural light.
^Please do not! The sunlight is not kind to me, it hurts.
^Not really no. Sometimes at night when it’s raining.
^Hold on, I have an idea. I’ll be right back.
^The chair that Lani is in glows for a second then begins trotting out of Indra’s room like a strange horse, carrying Lani with it.
^A short minute later, Lani returns, holding skeins of black and white yarn and a sketchbook.
^Lani lays out the materials in front of him, and flips the sketchbook to a page with an intricately sketched [insert design on tapestry here].
^He closes his eyes, and several sets of spectral hands appear over his own.
^They pick up the yarn and move in a blur, stretching the fibers, and weaving as if on an invisible loom.
^After a few minutes, Lani leans back and the hands vanish, leaving a neatly folded tapestry in his lap.
^Here we are! Now we can hang it up here, not quite past the window, and you can be safe from the sunlight, but you can keep your blinds open too!
